p.k: A Sad Loss Claire and her boyfriend have always counted on inheriting Claire's wealthy aunt's fortune. But when they hear she has a new heir lined

n.u: Gilbert & George: The South Bank Show Originals

p.n: Gilbert & George: The South Bank Show Originals IV (4)
p.k: Melvyn Bragg reflects on a classic episode of The South Bank Show featuring pioneering artists Gilbert and George

n.u: Anish Kapoor: The South Bank Show Originals

p.n: Anish Kapoor: The South Bank Show Originals IV (5)
p.k: New. Melvyn Bragg looks back at a classic South Bank Show episode from 1999 in which he met British sculptor Anish Kapoor
George Stubbs's Tygers at Play fetches big money at a sale of Old Masters in London. Plus, early 20th-century design draws bidders to a prestigious Parisien auction house
Dancer Dheerendra Tiwari showcases his dynamic performance style in this solo work entitled Shivo-Aham (An Ode to the Soul) at the 2017 Darbar festival in London

p.n: A Tribute To Randy Newman: Hollywood In Vienna
p.k: Gala concert with music from the biggest and most popular film comedies of all time, with the second part dedicated to Oscar-winning film scorer Randy Newman
A Sad Loss Claire and her boyfriend have always counted on inheriting Claire's wealthy aunt's fortune. But when they hear she has a new heir lined
Clerical Error While winding up his late father's affairs, Paul finds a bill demanding over ?1,000 for pornography. He's suspicious of the claim. for a very good reason
A look at the life of the legendary musician whose career spanned five decades, over 70 albums and an endless string of hits including Gentle

p.n: New: Madness: Video Killed The Radio Star
p.k: New. A fascinating look at the secrets and ideas behind the most iconic music videos ever made
An intimate portrait of Joan Fontaine, the Academy Award-winning actress who appeared in such films as Rebecca , Suspicion (1941), Jane Eyre (1944) and Othello (1952)
An eye-opening look at the remarkable career of Richard Harris, exploring his roles in movies such as This Sporting Life, A Man Called Horse and the Harry Potter films
Heir Presumptuous George is murdered, and one of his nephews is seen fleeing the scene. The problem is his nephews are identical twins
Down Along And Sheltering Palms An ex-soldier meets a beautiful woman on a nostalgic trip back to his old base. But she isn't all she seems
Home Sweet Home The photographers return home as they are challenged to capture themselves, their families and their roots. Johnny Briggs assists them back in the studio

n.u: Damien Hirst: The South Bank Show Originals

p.n: Damien Hirst: The South Bank Show Originals IV (6)
p.k: New. Melvyn Bragg reflects on his South Bank Show meeting with Damien Hirst, which revealed the artist as an avid art collector and businessman
There's drama at Christie's when a mystery buyer splashes out on an abstract work from 1920. Plus, a souvenir from the building of the Royal Yacht Britannia goes on sale
Zz Top An eye-opening look at the American Rock Hall-of-Famers who have sold over 50 million records worldwide

p.n: New: Roxy Music: Video Killed The Radio Star
p.k: New. Broadcasters Mark Ellen and Robert Elms discuss the impact of the first four Roxy Music albums. The popular British band were influential through the 70s and 80s
A profile of James Coburn, the tough-guy actor in films that included Our Man Flint and The Magnificent Seven, who won an Academy Award in 1998 for his role in Affliction
A fascinating look at the life and career of Dean Martin, the Rat Pack star famed for his film and stage partnership with the comedian Jerry Lewis
Noddy Holder narrates this fascinating look at the combination of personalities and events that gave rise to acid house music

p.n: Soundtracks: Songs That Defined History I (8)
p.k: Out, Loud and Proud A look at the growth of the gay rights movement and how music has played a vital role in preaching tolerance of the LGBT community
AC/DC frontman Brian Johnson meets some of rock'n'roll's biggest names to share stories about what life is really like on the road. First up is The Who's Roger Daltrey

n.u: New: ICON: Music Through The Lens

p.n: New: ICON: Music Through The Lens (1)
p.k: New. On Camera What defines an iconic image? This question provides the central theme for episode one as we are introduced to some of music photography's greatest names
